name: implant
content:
implant verb [T]
(OBJECT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to put an organ, group of cells, or device into the body in a medical operation: The owner's name and address is stored on a microchip and implanted in the dog's body. Compare
transplant verb

implant verb [T]
(IDEA)
to fix ideas, feelings, or opinions in someone else's mind: implant something in someone He implanted some very strange attitudes in his children. There is much debate on the issue of "therapists" implanting false memories of sexual abuse in adults.
